root.text:
2004 Porsche "Forty Years of the 911''

There's little new on the outside of this 911, save for a tiny badge on the decklid denoting it as an "anniversary'' model, but this is a very special Porsche. In September 1963 at Frankfurt, Porsche unveiled the first 911, an icon that defined the term sports car. Marking the occasion, Porsche is making 1963 copies of the anniversary model, featuring the above-mentioned subtle badging, plus 25 more hp (up to 340) than the standard model. That means this 911 has a top speed of 180 mph. Clearly a cause for celebration.

AutoWeek
September 22, 2003
